Class CardValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • CardValidator

  • public class CardValidator
extends java.lang.Object
    This class creates instances of the CreditCard class And provides methods to validate the card using the Luhn Algorithm Date 10/16/13
    Author:
    Adam Holt

    • Method Detail

      • validateCard

        public boolean validateCard(java.lang.String name,
                   java.lang.String type,
                   java.lang.String number)
        Checks if a credit card is valid based on the Luhn Algorithm Valid credit card information is used to create a new CreditCard instance and the instance is added to the ArrayList
        Parameters:
        name - Cardholder name
        type - Card type
        number - Card number
        Returns:
        true indicates a valid card, false indicates an invalid card

      • getValidCards

        public java.lang.String getValidCards()
        Converts each CreditCard instance in the ArrayList into a String
        Returns:
        String of all valid cards

      • reverseNumber

        private java.lang.String reverseNumber(java.lang.String num)
        Reverse the digits of a credit card number stored as a String Doubles every other digit to be used in the Luhn Algorith
        Parameters:
        num - The original number
        Returns:
        The original number with all the digits in reverse order with every other digit doubled

      • doubleDigit

        private int doubleDigit(int dig)
        Doubles an int - if the resulting int is two digits the digits are added together
        Parameters:
        dig - Digit to be doubled
        Returns:
        Double value of the int or the sum of the doubled int's digits

      • addDigits

        private int addDigits(java.lang.String num)
        Add all of the digits in a number stored as a String
        Parameters:
        num - The number whose digits are to be added together
        Returns:
        The total value of all the digits

      • checkType

        private boolean checkType(java.lang.String t,
                java.lang.String n)
        Check if the credit card type is valid based on the prefix of the number
        Parameters:
        t - Card type
        n - Card number
        Returns:
        true if the card is valid, false if it is not

      • checkLength

        private boolean checkLength(java.lang.String t,
                  java.lang.String n)
        Check if the card type is valid based on the length of the number
        Parameters:
        t - Card type
        n - Card number
        Returns:
        true if the card is valid, false if it is not
